titlestmt.titleproper: West Hartford, CT. Elmwood Community Church records, 1867-2024. RG5531
titlestmt.author: Madison Bellew

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-08-14 18:34:59 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: West Hartford, CT. Elmwood Community Church records, 1867-2024.
did.abstract: The Elmwood Community Church was founded in 1921 from the Elmwood Union Chapel Association with James F. English as its first pastor. Due to the growth of the church, the Sunday school, the Ladies Aid Society, and other organizations, a new church building was construction beginning in 1926 with a parsonage following in 1947. In 1958, the church steeple was raised. After 1967, the church continued to grow and change with the reorganization of boards and groups, renovation to the building, changing of pastors, and opening the facilities to the community. In 2024, the Elmwood Community Church permanently closed due to declining membership and funds. This collection includes records documenting the history, activities, and members of the church, Sunday school, and women's groups with minutes, building records, financial and legal records, newspaper articles, newsletters, reports, correspondence, programs, church histories, member records, and audio/visual materials.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the West Hartford, CT. Elmwood Community Church records, 1867-2024, RG5531. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by Elmwood Community Church in September 2024; 2024-39.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Madison Bellew, August 2025, using DACS.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Elmwood Community Church was founded in 1921 out of the Elmwood Union Chapel Association which was founded in 1897. The church began with 188 charter members representing 14 denominations and called James F. English as its first pastor. At the time the Sunday School and Ladies Aid Society were already established with the Sunday school being founded in 1873 and the Ladies Aid Society dating back to at least 1917 with the Ladies Benevolent Sewing Society going back further to 1857. Due to the growing membership in the church, Sunday school, ladies' society, and other organizations, the chapel building was quickly outgrown with construction for a new church beginning in 1926 along with the arrival of a new pastor, Charles K. Tracy, and the cornerstone laid in 1927. In 1947, the Cambridge St parsonage was constructed with the first occupant in 1948. In 1955, the church sanctuary was renovated along with the parish house in 1957. Shortly after in 1958, the church steeple was raised.

Between 1967 and 1969, the church experienced many changes with the disbanding of the women's federation that formed in 1928 from the Ladies Aid Society, the reorganization of the church boards, the burning of the mortgage, and the availability of church facilities to Greater Hartford organizations. Over the following years, the church formed and dissolved committees, updated the building and facilities, changed pastors, celebrated anniversaries, worked with the community, and opened their space to other community organizations and businesses. As the church entered the later 2010s and 2020s, membership and finances declined until the church permanently closed in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records documenting the history, activities, and members of the Elmwood Community Church in West Hartford, CT along with the associated Sunday school and women's groups of Elmwood. The collection contains documents, photographs, photo slides, VHS tapes, CDs, an audio reel, ledgers, notebooks, member cards, building plans, and photostat copies. The records include meeting minutes, financial records, legal records, newsletters, service and play programs, pamphlets, vital statistics, attendance and guest books, histories, newspaper articles, annual reports, correspondence, flyers and announcements.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into eight series, five of which are furthered arranged into subseries. Records within the series and subseries have been arranged chronologically by start date except for series 2: Member records, 1916-2023 which is arranged alphabetically.

phystech.head: Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Various hardware and software may be required to view the audio/visual materials and digital files included in the collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional records related Elmwood Chapel Association and Elmwood Community Church prior to 1952 can be found at the Conneticut State Library, and at FamilySearch.

odd.head: Content Warning
odd.p: This collection includes content and language that may be upsetting or triggering. These records reflect the language and attitudes of the historical period in which they were created; many of these terms are unacceptable today. The Congregational Library & Archives works to preserve Congregational history and stories while acknowledging that sometimes that history is problematic or questionable. We do this to preserve, contextualize, and reflect on the past so that we may learn from it.
This collection includes racist language and images.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Elmwood Sunday school and nursery school including attendance books, minutes, reports, account books, and flyers.

did.unittitle: Sunday School Minutes and Account Book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records and vital statistics relating to the members of Elmwood Community Church including member cards, member lists, guest books, baptismal records, member transfers, wedding announcements and information, funeral records, obituaries, directories, and registrar records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the women's federation which grew from the ladies sewing society and ladies aid society in 1931 to include all the women in the church split between various circles and which disbanded in 1967 with the individual circles continuing separately. The series includes minutes, account books, reports, correspondence, and other documents relating to the various women's groups.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records relating to the ladies benevolent sewing society in the south district of west hartford which began in 1857. The records include annual reports in two ledgers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records including annual reports, minutes, and account books from the ladies aid society which became circle 1 of the women's federation in 1930.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records from circle 1 of the women's federation which began as the ladies aid society and included annual reports and minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records including minutes and associated documents from circle 3 of the women's federation which merged with circle 5 in 1967 to become the daytime fellowship.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records from circle 4 of the women's federation including minutes, account books, and related documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records from circle 6 of the women's federation which disbanded in 2019 including minutes, member lists, and related documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains audio/visual materials including CDs, VHS tapes, an audio reel, photographs, photo slides, photo negatives, reverend portraits, and digital photos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs, photo slides, and photo negatives of church members, activities, and the building.

did.unittitle: ECC Pictures Christmas Pageant and Pancake Supper

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the church boards and organizations including minutes, financial records, correspondence, reports, and other related documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains minutes and related documents from the board of missions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains minutes and related documents from the christian education board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records from the church council which at times was known as the executive committee including minutes, reports, highlights, and related documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records from the board of deacons which was at times known as the board of lay life and work. The records include minutes, reports, pamphlets, and other related documents.

did.unittitle: Board for Lay Life Schedule Pamphlets

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains minutes and associated documents from the Elmweds groups which was an organization for married couples at Elmwood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains minutes from the men's club at Elmwood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records including minutes, reports, correspondence, and other related documents from the board of trustees which was at times known as the board of stewardship.

did.unittitle: Executive Committee, Trustees, and Finance Committee Minutes
Executive Committee, Trustees, and Finance Committee Minutes
Executive Committee, Trustees, and Finance Committee Minutes
Executive Committee, Trustees, and Finance Committee Minutes
Executive Committee, Trustees, and Finance Committee Minutes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records relating to the administration of Elmwood Community Church including annual reports, financial reports, correspondence, legal records, building plans, employment documents, committee records, renovation and property records, attendance books, minutes, memorial fund donations and records, constitutions, and other related documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains annual reports for the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains minutes, reports, and other related documents from the various committees at the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains donation letters, minutes, and reports relating to the memorial funds.

did.unittitle: Carllion Bell Fund Memorials and Contributions

phystech.head: Physical Access
phystech.p: This item can not be unfolded due to fragility.

did.unittitle: Chapel Association Minutes and Account Book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records relating to the history of Elmwood Community Church which was formerly the Elmwood Union Chapel Association. The records include programs, historical highlights, historian records, newspaper articles, member profiles, newsletters, pamphlets, sermons, announcements, and documents relating to various events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records including newspaper articles, programs, correspondence, and other documents relating to various members and pastors of the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains newsletters from the church with the weekly bulletin in earlier years and the "Elmwords" in later years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative and historical records intentionally organized by separate years including newspaper articles, reports, programs, correspondence, minutes, constitutions, and other documents.
